00007 enum BkmmParentingAction
00008 {
00009         // Note: Numbering of these is significant
00010         // Toggling the 3rd lsb shoul toggle between
00011         // corresponding "do" and "undo"
00012         // Also, 3rd lsb indicates "undo"
00013         BkmmParentingAdd = 0x0,  // 0
00014         BkmmParentingRemove,     // 1
00015         BkmmParentingCopy,       // 2
00016         BkmmParentingMove,       // 3
00017         BkmmParentingUndoAdd,    // 4
00018         BkmmParentingUndoRemove, // 5
00019         BkmmParentingUndoCopy,   // 6
00020         BkmmParentingUndoMove    // 7
00021 } ;
00022 
00023 enum BkmmParentingMasks
00024 {
00025         BkmmParentingNone = 0x0,
00026         BkmmParentingUndo = 0x4 
00027 } ;
00028 
00029 enum BkmmParentingTweak
00030 {
00031         BkmmParentingTweakNewParentWasCreated = 1 << 0,
00032         BkmmParentingTweakBonehead = 1 << 1,
00033 } ;

00042 + (BOOL)checkOKToInsertItems:(NSArray*)items intoParent:(Stark*)parent ;
00043 + (BOOL)checkOkToCopyItems:(NSArray*)items  ;
00044 + (void)alertCannotCopy ;
00045 
00046 // High-Level Item Editors featuring Undo, Redo, Show and Tell
00047 + (void)parentingAction:(enum BkmmParentingAction)action
00048                                   items:(NSArray*)items     // Stark or NSArray of Starks
00049                           toParents:(id)targetParent    // Stark or NSArray of Starks
00050                           atIndexes:(id)proposedIndex ; // NSNumber or NSArray of NSNumbers
00051 // Note: The above method uses arrays for targetParent and proposedIndex
00052 // to support undo, in case items need to be moved back to different
00053 // parents and different indexes
00054 // I tried registering multiple undo actions for each do action, but
00055 // besides being aesthetically unpleasing, that made it impossible
00056 // to deselect all before the undo, since Cocoa does not seem to give
00057 // any notification which distinguishes a group of undo executions.
00058 // NSUndoManagerWillUndoChangeNotification and NSRedoManagerWillUndoChangeNotification
00059 // come with each and every undo invocation, even if part of a group.
00060 // In next 3 methods, setting newObject(s) nil is OK; will remove the key/value pair
00061 + (void)changeObjectProperty:(NSString*)attributeKey
00062                                          ofItems:(NSArray*)items
00063                                    toObjects:(NSArray*)newObjects
00064                                  showAndTell:(BOOL)showAndTell ;
00065 + (void)changeObjectProperty:(NSString*)attributeKey
00066                                          ofItems:(NSArray*)items
00067                                         toObject:(id)newObject
00068                                  showAndTell:(BOOL)showAndTell ;
00069 + (void)changeObjectProperty:(NSString*)attributeKey
00070                                           ofItem:(id)item
00071                                         toObject:(id)newObject
00072                                  showAndTell:(BOOL)showAndTell ;
00073 
00074 // Very-High-Level Item Editors That Invoke the High-Level Item Editors
00075 + (void)moveItem:(id)item toParent:(id)parentNew atIndex:(int)indexNew ;
00076 + (void)moveItem:(id)item toLocation:(StarkLocation*)location ;
00077 + (void)swapPriorAndCurrentURLsOfItems:(NSArray*)items ;
00078 + (void)swapPriorAndCurrentURLsOfItem:(id)item ;
00079 + (void)addTags:(NSArray*)tags
00080         toBookmarks:(NSArray*)bookmarks ;
00081 + (void)clearFalseAlarmsOfItems:(NSArray*)items ;
00082 + (void)assignNewExternalIdentifiersTo:(NSArray*)items ;
00083 + (BOOL)copyCut:(BOOL)cut toClipboardItems:(NSArray*)items ;
00084 // items will be copied to intraAppCopyArray
00085 // If it has a url, the last item in items will have its url copied to the generalPasteboard as an NSString
00086 // returns YES if it all items were moveable, otherwise NO
00087 + (void)prefixNameToSortAtTopItems:(NSArray*)items ;
00088 + (void)prefixNameToSortAtBottomItems:(NSArray*)items ;
00089 + (void)prefixNameToSortNormallyItems:(NSArray*)items ;
